page.title: 04STAINTON-BY-LANGWORTH
page.content: {Stainton-by-Langworth}is a small, quiet village centred around a square.Stainton is situated in the north east corner of our D-BLOCK. Stainton has a church called St.Johns church.Some of the houses in Stainton have been restored.Most of the houses are built in the local stone or brick.The local brick is no longer made, so when extending houses it is hard to get bricks that match.An oil rig has now been built because oil is thought to be lying undiscovered in the ground. Two years ago a coffin,thought to be of the Roman period was discovered.The skeleton of a man was inside. There are no shops in{Stainton } although several of the farms sell potatoes and onions when they have been harvested.
